modules.description: This module represents matched ranges within a search string, providing access to their start and stop indices. It includes functions to retrieve the substring corresponding to the capture. Use this module to extract specific matched portions of a string after a pattern match.

This module represents a match found by a pattern in a search string. It provides operations to retrieve the matched substring, its position, and any captures associated with the match. It works with strings and lists of capture values, enabling precise text extraction and analysis. Use it to process pattern matches in structured text, such as parsing log entries or extracting fields from formatted input.

This module compiles and applies Lua-style string patterns to perform matching, searching, and substitution operations on strings. It supports finding the first match, matching from a specific position, and replacing matches using either a static string or a function that processes captures. The `Capture` submodule gives access to matched ranges and their corresponding substrings, while the `Match` submodule provides detailed information about each match, including its position, matched substring, and associated captures. Use this module to parse structured text, extract fields from formatted input, or perform complex string transformations based on pattern matches.
